summary.p: This is a prose work on the military exploits of a successful Cōḻā king. This manuscript is incomplete, because: 1) the final lines are abrupt, and 2) there are no verses of exaltation to be found in the end, which would be expected for such a work. In the story, the Cōḻā king is betrayed by his ministers, and Lord Murukaṉ helps him seek revenge. The result is that he is sucessful against a battle. A kāppu verse is present as the invocation (U2), after which the story begins (U3).

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Verso blank.
1 folio = Tēr Ūrnta Cōḻaṉ Carittiram: Invocation. No foliation.
24 folios = Tēr Ūrnta Cōḻaṉ Carittiram: Text. Tamil foliation {1}-24.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation, minimal damage

layoutDesc.layout: The entire leaf is not used to write. As the manuscript is very thin and long, the columns have been made, presumably for ease of reading. The several blank folios at the end may suggest the text is complete, even though the story ends rather abruptly. Stanzas distributed aṭi-wise per line and final letter(s) indented to the right at the end of lines.

handNote.desc: Hand #2. Definitely a different scribe from that of BnF Indien 428a. Neat handwriting. Difficult to differentiate ṟ and r.

binding.p: Only one string-hole, 150-155 mm from left edge.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year kara of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1831-1832, 1771-1772, 1711-1712, etc. See colophon (U2a, f[1]v1). Bundle not dated by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) nor by Cabaton (1912).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 61, no. 248.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In Variétés orientales, 177‒224. Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 98r, no. 397 428.

encodingDesc.p: I differentiate between e and ē, and o and ō. Transliteration according to Tamil Lexicon conventions.
